Prep libraries and import datasheets
```{r}
library(tidyverse)

video_events <- read_csv("video Notable Events.csv")
video_morts <- read_csv("Mort Counts for Vid Analysis.csv")
no_event_vids <- read_csv("No Event Videos.csv")
video_times <- read_csv("Video Start and Stop Times.csv")
```

Play around
```{r}
#create bar chart showing notable events in both AM and PM
video_events %>%
  group_by(event_type, time_of_day) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = event_type, y = count, fill = time_of_day)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Notable Events by Time of Day",
       x = "Event",
       y = "Count") +
  theme_minimal()

for (i in seq_len(nrow(video_events))) {
  if (video_events$time_of_day[i] == "pm") {
    x <- video_events$video_code[i] %% 10
    if (x != 2) {
      if (video_events$event_type[i] != "Feed"){
      print(video_events$video_code[i])}
    }
  }
}

#code to count the number of feed events that happen during am period and report them
feed_events_am <- video_events %>%
  filter(event_type == "Feed" & time_of_day == "am") %>%
  nrow()

feed_events_pm <- video_events %>%
  filter(event_type == "Feed" & time_of_day == "pm") %>%
  nrow()

#code to find duplicate video codes in feed_events_am
duplicate_feed_events_am <- video_events %>%
  filter(event_type == "Feed" & time_of_day == "am") %>%
  group_by(video_code) %>%
  filter(n() > 1) %>%
  distinct(video_code)
```
